statement:
Let $R$ be a ring and let $M$ be an $R$-module. Recall that if
${\mathrm{pd}_R}M$ denotes the projective dimension of $M$, then
$${\mathrm{pd}_R}M\leqslant n$$ if and only if
$${\mathrm{Ext}^{m}_{R}}(M,-)=0$$ for $m>n$. Here $\mathrm{Ext}$ denotes
the derived functor of $\mathrm{Hom}$.

**Proposition 1.** Assume that $$\xymatrix{
0\ar[r] & A\ar[r] & B\ar[r] & C\ar[r] & 0
}$$ is a short exact sequence of $R$-modules such that the projective
dimension of each $A$, $B$, $C$ is finite. Then
$${\mathrm{pd}_R}A\leqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}B,\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}C - 1\ \};$$
$${\mathrm{pd}_R}B\leqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}A,\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}C\ \};$$
$${\mathrm{pd}_R}C\leqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}B,\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}A + 1\ \}.$$

*Proof.* Let $T(X)={\mathrm{Hom}_{R}}(X,-)$ be a functor from the
category of $R$-modules to the category of functors. This functor is
contravariant and induces the following long exact sequence:
$$\xymatrix{
\cdots\ar[r] & {\mathrm{Ext}^{n}_{R}}(C,-)\ar[r] & {\mathrm{Ext}^{n}_{R}}(B,-)\ar[r] & {\mathrm{Ext}^{n}_{R}}(A,-)\ar[r] &{\mathrm{Ext}^{n+1}_{R}}(C,-)\ar[r] & \cdots
}$$ Assume that ${\mathrm{pd}_R}B\leqslant m$ and
${\mathrm{pd}_R}C\leqslant m+1$ (i.e.
$m\geqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}B,\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}C-1\ \}$).
Then the above sequence (together with the remark at the begining) gives
us $${\mathrm{Ext}^{k}_{R}}(A,-)=0$$ for $k>m$. In particular
${\mathrm{pd}_R}A\leqslant m$ and thus
$${\mathrm{pd}_R}A\leqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}B,\ {\mathrm{pd}_R}C - 1\ \}.$$
The proof for other inequalities is analogous. $\square$\
We can state similar facts for injective dimension:\
**Proposition 2.** Assume that $$\xymatrix{
0\ar[r] & A\ar[r] & B\ar[r] & C\ar[r] & 0
}$$ is a short exact sequence of $R$-modules such that the injective
dimension of each $A$, $B$, $C$ is finite. Then
$${\mathrm{id}_R}A\leqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{id}_R}B,\ {\mathrm{id}_R}C + 1\ \};$$
$${\mathrm{id}_R}B\leqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{id}_R}A,\ {\mathrm{id}_R}C\ \};$$
$${\mathrm{id}_R}C\leqslant\mathrm{max}\{\ {\mathrm{id}_R}B,\ {\mathrm{id}_R}A - 1\ \}.$$
*Proof.* The proof is analogous to the proof of Proposition 1. We just
use ${\mathrm{Ext}^{*}_{R}}(-,M)$ instead of
${\mathrm{Ext}^{*}_{R}}(M,-)$. Note that in this case $\mathrm{Ext}$ is
a covariant functor which gives us ,,dual” inequalities. $\square$
names: projective dimension and short exact sequences
